snippet: Alexei Ponikarovsky scored the winning goal at 17 minutes 21 seconds into overtime to give the Devils a 2-1 series lead against the Flyers.
abstract: New Jersey Devils defeat Philadelphia Flyers, 4-3, in overtime, to lead NHL Eastern Conference semifinals, 2-1. (M)
lead_paragraph: NEWARK -- When Ilya Kovalchuk stepped on the ice before Game 3 against the Philadelphia Flyers on Thursday night, he was bathed in a spotlight and the crowd at Prudential Center thundered its approval, creating an even bigger din later when he scored a goal. Kovalchuk, the $100 million forward, had missed the last game against the Flyers with a bad back, but the Devils won anyway. Kovalchuk saved the best for last Thursday, firing a pinpoint stretch pass that Alexei Ponikarovsky turned into an overtime goal and a 4-3 victory.

headline.main: After Losing Lead Twice, Devils Grab It for Good
